question: How do the live classes work?
answer: Our live classes are conducted via Zoom with small groups of 10-15 students maximum. Each session is interactive with speaking practice, real-time feedback, and engaging activities. All sessions are recorded so you can review them later.

question: What if I miss a live class?
answer: Don't worry! All live sessions are recorded and available within 24 hours. You'll also receive class notes and homework assignments. Our instructors are available for one-on-one makeup sessions if needed.

question: How do I know which course level is right for me?
answer: Take our free 10-minute assessment test! It evaluates your grammar, vocabulary, and comprehension skills to recommend the perfect course level. You can also schedule a free consultation with our instructors.

question: What technology do I need for the courses?
answer: You'll need a computer or tablet with internet connection, microphone, and camera. We use Zoom for classes (free account works fine). All course materials are provided digitally through our learning platform.

question: Are there any additional costs beyond the course fee?
answer: No hidden costs! The course fee includes all materials, recorded sessions, instructor support, and access to our student community. The only additional cost might be a reliable internet connection.

question: Can I get a refund if I'm not satisfied?
answer: Absolutely! We offer a 100% satisfaction guarantee. If you're not completely satisfied within the first 2 weeks, we'll provide a full refund, no questions asked.

question: Do you provide certificates upon completion?
answer: Yes! Upon successful completion of your course, you'll receive a verified certificate of completion that you can add to your LinkedIn profile or resume. Our certificates are recognized by many employers worldwide.

question: How long does it take to see improvement?
answer: Most students notice improvement in their confidence and speaking ability within the first 2-3 weeks. Significant progress typically occurs by week 4-5, with major fluency gains by course completion. Results vary based on starting level and practice time.
